metadata.title: CVE-2015-0858 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Cool Projects TarDiff allows local users to write to arbitrary files via asymlink attack on a pathname in a /tmp/tardiff-$$ temporary directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tardiff - 0.1-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tardiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.1-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1').
